intro: Heptapleurum sibayakense, commonly known as the Sibayak heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pentaphylacaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically the island of Mindanao, where it grows in tropical rainforests. The plant is a shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It has simple, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals.
